title: Implement POST /batch/task endpoint (batch_create_tasks)
description:
Implement the MCP tool to create multiple tasks in a single API call.

**Inputs:**
- `tasks` (array, required): Array of task objects to create. Each task object can have:
  - `title` (string, required): Task title
  - `projectId` (string, optional): Project ID (defaults to inbox)
  - `content` (string, optional): Task description/notes
  - `allDay` (boolean, optional): Whether this is an all-day task
  - `startDate` (string, optional): Start date in ISO 8601 format
  - `dueDate` (string, optional): Due date in ISO 8601 format
  - `timeZone` (string, optional): IANA timezone (e.g., "America/New_York")
  - `reminders` (array of strings, optional): Reminders in iCalendar format
  - `repeat` (string, optional): Recurrence rule in RRULE format
  - `priority` (number, optional): 0=None, 1=Low, 3=Medium, 5=High
  - `items` (array, optional): Subtask/checklist items

**Outputs:**
Returns an array of created Task objects, each containing:
- `id` (string): Unique task identifier
- `projectId` (string): Parent project ID
- `title` (string): Task title
- `content` (string): Task description
- `priority` (number): Priority level
- `status` (number): 0=Normal, 1=Completed
- `dueDate` (string | null): Due date
- `startDate` (string | null): Start date
- `tags` (array of strings): Tags
- And other task fields

**Description:**
This endpoint allows creating multiple tasks in a single API request. This is more efficient than making individual create requests when adding many tasks at once.

**API Endpoint:** POST /batch/task

**Request Body Format:**
```json
{
  "add": [
    { "title": "Task 1", "projectId": "project_id", "priority": 1 },
    { "title": "Task 2", "projectId": "project_id", "priority": 3 }
  ]
}
```

**Tool Name:** batch_create_tasks

**Implementation Notes:**
1. Add `batchCreateTasks` method to the SDK client (src/sdk/client.ts)
2. Add MCP tool wrapper in src/index.ts
3. Consider adding validation for minimum/maximum batch size
4. Consider rate limiting implications for large batches

title: Implement GET /project/{projectId} endpoint (get_project_by_id)
description:
Implement the MCP tool to get a project by ID without including its tasks.

**Inputs:**
- `projectId` (string, required): The unique identifier of the project to retrieve

**Outputs:**
Returns a Project object with the following fields:
- `id` (string): Unique project identifier
- `name` (string): Project name
- `color` (string): Hex color code (e.g., "#ff6b6b")
- `sortOrder` (number): Position in project list
- `closed` (boolean): Whether project is archived
- `groupId` (string | null): Parent folder ID
- `viewMode` (string): "list", "kanban", or "timeline"
- `kind` (string): "TASK" or "NOTE"

**Description:**
This endpoint retrieves a specific project by its ID without including tasks. Unlike `get_project` which uses `GET /project/{projectId}/data` and returns both project and tasks, this provides a lightweight way to fetch just the project metadata.

**API Endpoint:** GET /project/{projectId}

**Tool Name:** get_project_by_id

**Notes:**
- The existing `get_project` tool uses the `/data` variant which includes tasks
- This tool should be used when only project metadata is needed

title: Add list_tasks_in_project convenience tool
description:
Add a convenience MCP tool to list all tasks in a specific project.

**Inputs:**
- `projectId` (string, required): The unique identifier of the project

**Outputs:**
Returns an array of Task objects with the following fields for each task:
- `id` (string): Unique task identifier
- `title` (string): Task title
- `content` (string): Task description
- `priority` (number): 0=None, 1=Low, 3=Medium, 5=High
- `status` (number): 0=Normal, 1=Completed
- `dueDate` (string | null): Due date
- `startDate` (string | null): Start date
- `tags` (array of strings): Tags
- `items` (array): Subtasks

**Description:**
While `get_project` returns tasks along with project metadata, this tool provides a focused way to list just the tasks in a project. This is useful when the user only needs task information and already has the project details.

**API Endpoint:** GET /project/{projectId}/data (same as get_project, but returns only tasks)

**Tool Name:** list_tasks_in_project

**Implementation Notes:**
1. Uses the existing `getProjectWithTasks` SDK method
2. Returns only the `tasks` array, not the project object
3. Consider adding optional filter parameters in future (status, priority, date range)

title: Implement POST /project/{projectId} endpoint (update_project)
description:
Implement the MCP tool to update an existing project's properties.

**Inputs:**
- `projectId` (string, required): The unique identifier of the project to update
- `name` (string, optional): New project name
- `color` (string, optional): New hex color code (e.g., "#ff6b6b")
- `viewMode` (string, optional): New view mode - "list", "kanban", or "timeline"
- `kind` (string, optional): New project type - "TASK" or "NOTE"

**Outputs:**
Returns the updated Project object with the following fields:
- `id` (string): Unique project identifier
- `name` (string): Project name
- `color` (string): Hex color code
- `sortOrder` (number): Position in project list
- `closed` (boolean): Whether project is archived
- `groupId` (string | null): Parent folder ID
- `viewMode` (string): "list", "kanban", or "timeline"
- `kind` (string): "TASK" or "NOTE"

**Description:**
This endpoint allows updating an existing project's properties. Only the fields that are provided will be updated; other fields remain unchanged.

**API Endpoint:** POST /project/{projectId}

**Tool Name:** update_project

**Implementation Notes:**
1. Add `updateProject` method to the SDK client (src/sdk/client.ts)
2. Add MCP tool wrapper in src/index.ts
3. Validate that at least one field is provided for update

title: Create tickets for every TickTick API endpoint
description:
Once OAuth is working, create individual tickets for implementing each TickTick API endpoint in the MCP server.

Each endpoint ticket must include:
- **Inputs** - All parameters, their types, and whether required/optional
- **Outputs** - Response structure and data types
- **Description** - What the endpoint does

Goal: Full coverage of the TickTick API.

title: Enhance update_task tool with missing parameters
description:
Enhance the update_task MCP tool to support all available API parameters.

**Currently Implemented Parameters:**
- `taskId` (string, required)
- `title` (string, optional)
- `content` (string, optional)
- `dueDate` (string | null, optional)
- `priority` (number, optional)
- `tags` (array, optional)

**Missing Parameters to Add:**
- `projectId` (string, optional): Move task to a different project
- `allDay` (boolean, optional): Whether this is an all-day task
- `startDate` (string | null, optional): Start date in ISO 8601 format or null to remove
- `timeZone` (string, optional): IANA timezone (e.g., "America/New_York")
- `reminders` (array of strings | null, optional): Reminders in iCalendar TRIGGER format or null to clear
- `repeat` (string | null, optional): Recurrence rule in RRULE format or null to remove
- `items` (array, optional): Array of subtask/checklist items

**Description:**
The current update_task implementation only supports basic task fields. This ticket adds support for moving tasks between projects, updating scheduling (startDate, allDay, timeZone), reminders, recurring tasks, and subtasks/checklists.

**Implementation Notes:**
1. Update Zod schema in src/index.ts to include new optional parameters
2. Ensure SDK client passes all fields correctly
3. Document that null values can be used to clear optional fields

title: Document TickTick API authentication and endpoints
description:
Review the TickTick OpenAPI documentation at https://developer.ticktick.com/docs#/openapi and document:

1. **Authentication** - How does auth work for this API?
2. **Endpoints** - What endpoints are available?
3. **Data flow** - What data goes where and comes from where?

This research will inform the MCP server implementation.

title: Build TickTick SDK from API documentation
description:

The SDK should:

- Provide typed methods for all documented endpoints
- Include proper error handling
